Usage¶

Installation¶

Deployment notes go here

User Credentials¶

SALTS has an object class, UserCredentials, that handles the information for the current user.

class src.credentials.credentials_manager.UserCredentials(_id: int, _first_name: str, _last_name: str, _location: str, _department: str, _title: str)¶

This class handles the credentials for a user, including their department and title.

Methods:

id(), first_name(), last_name(), location(), department(), title(): Will return the respective info field.

name(): Will return the user’s first and last name.

is_manager(): Will return True if the user’s title is “Manager”, False otherwise.

validate(): Checks each of the user info fields to ensure its validity. Will throw an exception if any are invalid.

validate()¶

Checks all of the information entered for a user for validity. Will return an error if any of the fields are too long, too short, or have invalid characters.

Validation Checks¶

SALTS has several built-in validation checks to ensure that the data passed into it is valid. For example, the check_field_size function will raise a ValueError if its input is outside the specified bounds.

This module includes a series of checks you can run to validate data. All of them should be run in a try-except block as they will throw exceptions if any of them fail.

src.validation.validation_checks.check_data_type(data_to_check, input_type, type_name: str = None)¶

Checks if the input is of the specified type. Will raise an exception if it isn’t.

Parameters:

  • data_to_check – The data to run a check on.

  • input_type – The data type to be checked against.

  • type_name – Deprecated. Does nothing.

Raises:

TypeError – If the input is not of the specified type.

Returns:

None

src.validation.validation_checks.check_field_size(input_str: str, max_size: int, min_size: int)¶

Checks if the input string is within the specified size limits. Will raise an exception if it isn’t.

Parameters:

  • input_str (str) – The string to be checked.

  • max_size (int) – The upper size limit.

  • min_size (int) – The lower size limit.

Raises:

ValueError – If the input is outside the specified range.

Returns:

None

src.validation.validation_checks.is_alpha_or_hyphen(input_str: str)¶
Deprecated:

Checks if the input consists of only letters and up to one hyphen. Will return an exception otherwise. Used to validate the name of a person.

Parameters:

input_str (str) – The string to be checked.

Raises:

ValueError – If invalid characters are found in the input string.

Returns:

None

src.validation.validation_checks.is_positive(input_num: int)¶

Checks if the input number is positive. Will raise an exception if it isn’t. Intended for ID numbers and other ints, but should be usable with floats as well.

Parameters:

input_num (int or float) – The number to be checked.

src.validation.validation_checks.list_check(input_obj, input_list: list)¶

Checks if the input object is in the input list. Will raise an exception if it isn’t.

Parameters:

  • input_obj – The data to be checked.

  • input_list (list or tuple) – The list to be checked against.

Raises:

ValueError – If the input object isn’t in the input list.

Returns:

None
